Summary : This bar chart presents the monthly energy consumption profile in kilowatt-hours (KWH) for two categories, "onpk" and "offpk", across the months of the year. bar chart: Title & Axes : • Title: "Energy Profile". • Y-axis: "KWH" (kilowatt-hours), with tick marks at 0, 10000, 20000, 30000, and 40000. • X-axis: Months labeled as D, J, F, M, A, M, J, J, A, S, O, N, D (presumably December through November, with December repeated at both ends). Data Points : • Series "onpk" (lighter bars): Monthly KWH values for each month, generally lower than "offpk". • Series "offpk" (darker bars): Monthly KWH values for each month, generally higher than "onpk", with a pronounced spike in September. • Exact values are not labeled, but relative heights indicate trends. Design Encodings : • Two bar patterns: "onpk" (lighter fill), "offpk" (darker fill). • Grouped bars for each month. • No error bars or additional statistical annotations. Distribution & Trends : • Both "onpk" and "offpk" show monthly variation. • "offpk" is consistently higher than "onpk" for all months. • September shows a dramatic spike in "offpk" consumption, reaching the highest value on the chart. • Other months show moderate variation, with some months (e.g., January, October, December) having higher values than others (e.g., May, June, July). Analysis : • The energy consumption for "offpk" is consistently greater than "onpk" throughout the year. • There is a significant anomaly in September, where "offpk" usage surges to a peak far above all other months. • The rest of the year shows moderate fluctuations, with some seasonality possibly present, but no other months approach the September peak. • The pattern suggests a possible event or operational change in September affecting "offpk" energy use. Summary : This bar chart shows the monthly maximum demand history in kilowatts (KW) over a one-year period, with each month represented by its initial letter. bar chart: Title & Axes : • Title: "Demand History". • Y-axis label: "Max KW" (kilowatts), with tick marks at 0, 50, 100, 150, 200, 250. • X-axis: Months, labeled by initials: D, J, F, M, A, M, J, J, A, S, O, N, D (presumably December through December). Data Points : • Each bar represents the maximum KW demand for a given month. • Most months have values between approximately 75 and 125 KW. • One month (September, labeled "S") shows a significant spike, reaching just below 200 KW. • All other months remain below 150 KW. Design Encodings : • Bars are uniform in color and style. • No additional series, error bars, or trend lines. Distribution & Trends : • The data is relatively stable across most months, with a single prominent outlier. • The highest demand occurs in September. • No clear upward or downward trend across the year. Analysis : • The demand is generally consistent except for a sharp peak in September, indicating an unusual event or seasonal effect during that month. • No other months approach the September maximum, suggesting the spike is an anomaly rather than part of a regular pattern. Summary : This bar chart shows the generation rate in cents per kilowatt-hour (KWH) for different months, with each bar representing a specific month labeled by its initial. bar chart: Title & Axes : • Title: "Generation Rate" • Y-axis: "Cents Per KWH" with tick marks at 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16, 18, 20. • X-axis: Month initials labeled as D, F, A, J, A, O, D. Data Points : • Each bar corresponds to a month (D, F, A, J, A, O, D). • All bars are between 6 and 8 cents per KWH, except for the two central bars (A and J), which are slightly higher, close to 8 cents per KWH. Design Encodings : • Bars are vertical and shaded with a light fill. • No additional colours, markers, or error bars are present. Distribution & Trends : • Most months cluster just above 6 cents per KWH. • Two months (A and J) show a noticeable but small increase, approaching 8 cents per KWH. Analysis : • The generation rate is relatively stable across most months, with a slight peak in the middle months (A and J). There are no extreme outliers or dramatic changes in the data. Your Supplier: NEXTERA ENERGY SERVICES CONNECTICUT Phone: (866) 410-4392 20 GREENWAY PLAZA SUITE 600 HOUSTON, TX 77046 Mail Payment To: EVERSOURCE PO BOX 56002 BOSTON MA 02205-6002 Summary : This is a simple blue line drawing of a loaf of bread, depicted with curved lines and internal scoring marks. illustration: Scene Overview : • Main subject is a stylized loaf of bread, shown in outline. • The loaf is drawn with a single continuous blue line forming an oval shape. • Three curved lines inside the loaf represent scoring or cuts typical of bread. • The drawing is minimalistic, with no background or additional elements. Technical Details : • No scale bar, text, or annotations present. • The illustration uses a single blue color for all lines. • No shading, texture, or perspective cues. Spatial Relationships : • The loaf is oriented diagonally from lower left to upper right. • The scoring lines are parallel and evenly spaced within the loaf outline. Analysis : • The image conveys the recognizable shape and scoring of a loaf of bread in a simple, iconic style. Summary : This is a handwritten identifier or code, likely referencing a document, record, or postal box. logo / stamp / identifier: Text Content : • "P.O. 240 262" written in cursive/print hybrid handwriting. • "P.O." is commonly an abbreviation for "Post Office" or "P.O. Box". • The number "240 262" follows, separated by a space. Style & Placement : • All characters are written in black ink. • The handwriting is legible, with a large, looping "P". • No additional graphic elements, borders, or logos are present. • No date, signature, or decorative marks. Analysis : • The mark serves as a simple identifier, likely for referencing a specific P.O. box or record number. No branding or additional meaning is conveyed beyond the identifier itself. Summary : This image shows a payment approval stamp and a handwritten signature, indicating authorization for a financial transaction. stamp and signature: Stamp Details : • Text: "Approved For Payment" in red ink. • Orientation: Text is angled upward from left to right. • Ink colour: Red. • No border or date visible. Signature Details : • Handwritten signature in red ink below the stamp text. • Signature is stylized and not fully legible; appears to start with a "W". • Slant: Rightward. • No underline or flourish. Placement & Dimensions : • Stamp text is positioned above the signature. • Both elements are closely aligned, suggesting intentional association. Analysis : • The stamp and signature together serve as formal approval for payment, with the red ink providing visual emphasis and authority. Please Make Checks Payable to EVERSOURCE And Return This Portion With Your Payment. Thank You.

Total Delivery Services $3,156.88 Account Number: 51418123048 Statement Date: Dec 19 2023 Billing Cycle: 9 Service Address: BERLIN EMMA WILLARD SCHOOL 1088 NORTON RD BERLIN CT 06037 __Account Messages__ Non-residential and residential non-hardship customers may be subject to a 1.00% late payment charge if the "Total Amount Due" is not received by Feb 20 2024 NET KWH PURCHASES: 38062 PURCHASES - 1647 Sales (Current Sales 1647 + Prev Carryfwd Sales 0) = 36415. New Carry Fwd Sales = 0 NET ON PEAK KWH PURCHASES: 11389 PURCHASES - 238 SALES = 11,151 NET OFF PEAK KWH PURCHASES: 26673 PURCHASES - 1409 SALES = 25,264 *The combined Public Charge represents a combination of three formally known as: "Conservation and Load Management Charge, Renewable Energy Investment Charge, and the System Benefits Charge." This charge also includes the Conservation Adjustment Mechanism approved by the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority in Docket No. 13-11-14. **Effective January 1, 2007, The Generation Services Charge (GSC) and the Bypassable Federally Mandated Congestion Charge (BFMCC) have been combined into the "GSC Charge" listed in the Supplier Services Section of your bill. The GSC reflects all of the cost of procuring energy from Eversource wholesale suppliers. The BFMCC portion of this line item is $0.0003/kWh. If you multiply the BFMCC rate by the number of kWhs on your bill, you can calculate the dollar amount associated with the BFMCC. Local Delivery Improvements: Recovers company investments that protect, strengthen or modernize the electric grid. Beginning this month, you will receive a bill credit as a result of the performance penalty assessed by the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority related to Tropical Storm Isaias. This credit is based on usage and varies by customer rate. For the typical customer using 700 kWh of electricity a month, the credit is about $1 a month and will be in effect for 12 billing cycles. See "TS Isaias Performance Penalty" on page 2 of your bill.

Summary : This bar chart presents the monthly energy consumption profile in kilowatt-hours (KWH) for two categories, "onpk" and "offpk", across the months of the year.

bar chart:
Title & Axes :
  • Title: "Energy Profile".
  • Y-axis: "KWH" (kilowatt-hours), with tick marks at 0, 10000, 20000, 30000, and 40000.
  • X-axis: Months labeled as D, J, F, M, A, M, J, J, A, S, O, N, D (presumably December through November, with December repeated at both ends).

Data Points :
  • Series "onpk" (lighter bars): Monthly KWH values for each month, generally lower than "offpk".
  • Series "offpk" (darker bars): Monthly KWH values for each month, generally higher than "onpk", with a pronounced spike in September.
  • Exact values are not labeled, but relative heights indicate trends.

Design Encodings :
  • Two bar patterns: "onpk" (lighter fill), "offpk" (darker fill).
  • Grouped bars for each month.
  • No error bars or additional statistical annotations.

Distribution & Trends :
  • Both "onpk" and "offpk" show monthly variation.
  • "offpk" is consistently higher than "onpk" for all months.
  • September shows a dramatic spike in "offpk" consumption, reaching the highest value on the chart.
  • Other months show moderate variation, with some months (e.g., January, October, December) having higher values than others (e.g., May, June, July).

Analysis :
  • The energy consumption for "offpk" is consistently greater than "onpk" throughout the year.
  • There is a significant anomaly in September, where "offpk" usage surges to a peak far above all other months.
  • The rest of the year shows moderate fluctuations, with some seasonality possibly present, but no other months approach the September peak.
  • The pattern suggests a possible event or operational change in September affecting "offpk" energy use.

Summary : This bar chart shows the monthly maximum demand history in kilowatts (KW) over a one-year period, with each month represented by its initial letter.

bar chart:

Title & Axes :
  • Title: "Demand History".
  • Y-axis label: "Max KW" (kilowatts), with tick marks at 0, 50, 100, 150, 200, 250.
  • X-axis: Months, labeled by initials: D, J, F, M, A, M, J, J, A, S, O, N, D (presumably December through December).

Data Points :
  • Each bar represents the maximum KW demand for a given month.
  • Most months have values between approximately 75 and 125 KW.
  • One month (September, labeled "S") shows a significant spike, reaching just below 200 KW.
  • All other months remain below 150 KW.

Design Encodings :
  • Bars are uniform in color and style.
  • No additional series, error bars, or trend lines.

Distribution & Trends :
  • The data is relatively stable across most months, with a single prominent outlier.
  • The highest demand occurs in September.
  • No clear upward or downward trend across the year.

Analysis :
  • The demand is generally consistent except for a sharp peak in September, indicating an unusual event or seasonal effect during that month.
  • No other months approach the September maximum, suggesting the spike is an anomaly rather than part of a regular pattern.

Summary : This bar chart shows the generation rate in cents per kilowatt-hour (KWH) for different months, with each bar representing a specific month labeled by its initial.

bar chart:
Title & Axes :
  • Title: "Generation Rate"
  • Y-axis: "Cents Per KWH" with tick marks at 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16, 18, 20.
  • X-axis: Month initials labeled as D, F, A, J, A, O, D.

Data Points :
  • Each bar corresponds to a month (D, F, A, J, A, O, D).
  • All bars are between 6 and 8 cents per KWH, except for the two central bars (A and J), which are slightly higher, close to 8 cents per KWH.

Design Encodings :
  • Bars are vertical and shaded with a light fill.
  • No additional colours, markers, or error bars are present.

Distribution & Trends :
  • Most months cluster just above 6 cents per KWH.
  • Two months (A and J) show a noticeable but small increase, approaching 8 cents per KWH.

Analysis :
  • The generation rate is relatively stable across most months, with a slight peak in the middle months (A and J). There are no extreme outliers or dramatic changes in the data.

Summary : This is a simple blue line drawing of a loaf of bread, depicted with curved lines and internal scoring marks.

illustration:
Scene Overview :
  • Main subject is a stylized loaf of bread, shown in outline.
  • The loaf is drawn with a single continuous blue line forming an oval shape.
  • Three curved lines inside the loaf represent scoring or cuts typical of bread.
  • The drawing is minimalistic, with no background or additional elements.

Technical Details :
  • No scale bar, text, or annotations present.
  • The illustration uses a single blue color for all lines.
  • No shading, texture, or perspective cues.

Spatial Relationships :
  • The loaf is oriented diagonally from lower left to upper right.
  • The scoring lines are parallel and evenly spaced within the loaf outline.

Analysis :
  • The image conveys the recognizable shape and scoring of a loaf of bread in a simple, iconic style.

Summary : This is a handwritten identifier or code, likely referencing a document, record, or postal box.

logo / stamp / identifier:
  Text Content :
    • "P.O. 240 262" written in cursive/print hybrid handwriting.
    • "P.O." is commonly an abbreviation for "Post Office" or "P.O. Box".
    • The number "240 262" follows, separated by a space.
  Style & Placement :
    • All characters are written in black ink.
    • The handwriting is legible, with a large, looping "P".
    • No additional graphic elements, borders, or logos are present.
    • No date, signature, or decorative marks.

Analysis :
  • The mark serves as a simple identifier, likely for referencing a specific P.O. box or record number. No branding or additional meaning is conveyed beyond the identifier itself.

Signature Details :

  • Signature is stylized and not fully legible; appears to start with a "W".
  • Slant: Rightward.
  • No underline or flourish.

Placement & Dimensions :
  • Stamp text is positioned above the signature.
  • Both elements are closely aligned, suggesting intentional association.

Analysis :
  • The stamp and signature together serve as formal approval for payment, with the red ink providing visual emphasis and authority.

__Account Messages__  
Non-residential and residential non-hardship customers may be subject to a 1.00% late payment charge if the "Total Amount Due" is not received by Feb 20 2024

NET KWH PURCHASES:  38062  PURCHASES  -  1647  Sales  (Current Sales 1647  +  Prev Carryfwd Sales 0) = 36415.  New Carry Fwd Sales = 0
NET ON PEAK KWH PURCHASES:  11389 PURCHASES  -  238 SALES  =  11,151
NET OFF PEAK KWH PURCHASES:  26673 PURCHASES  -  1409 SALES  =  25,264

*The combined Public Charge represents a combination of three formally known as: "Conservation and Load Management Charge, Renewable Energy Investment Charge, and the System Benefits Charge." This charge also includes the Conservation Adjustment Mechanism approved by the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority in Docket No. 13-11-14.
**Effective January 1, 2007, The Generation Services Charge (GSC) and the Bypassable Federally Mandated Congestion Charge (BFMCC) have been combined into the "GSC Charge" listed in the Supplier Services Section of your bill. The GSC reflects all of the cost of procuring energy from Eversource wholesale suppliers. The BFMCC portion of this line item is $0.0003/kWh. If you multiply the BFMCC rate by the number of kWhs on your bill, you can calculate the dollar amount associated with the BFMCC.
Local Delivery Improvements: Recovers company investments that protect, strengthen or modernize the electric grid.
Beginning this month, you will receive a bill credit as a result of the performance penalty assessed by the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority related to Tropical Storm Isaias. This credit is based on usage and varies by customer rate. For the typical customer using 700 kWh of electricity a month, the credit is about $1 a month and will be in effect for 12 billing cycles. See "TS Isaias Performance Penalty" on page 2 of your bill.
